Description: Side-wall and part of one end-wall of a rectangular wooden shabti-box; painted decoration on plaster: scene of a man offering a smoking incense-burner to the enthroned figure of Osiris on the side; panel of Hieroglyphic text beneath the Anubis-jackal on the end; attachment-knobs and an indication of a single internal divider remain. The box is disscussed by David Aston in Oudheidkundige Mededlingen uit het Rijksmuseum van Oudheden 74. 25, where he gives it a late 19th dynasty date on stylistic grounds.
Condition: incomplete - one side-wall and part of one end-wall only
